results.title: Seven Days in May
results.creator_credit: Seven Arts, Joel Productions, Edward Lewis and John Frankenheimer
results.brief_description: American president Jordan Lymans (Frederic March) has signed a peace treaty with the Russians which results in a violent public opinion campaign against him. The treaty also incurs the wrath of conservative military brass General Scott (Burt Lancaster in a part inspired by the far-right ramblings of one General Edwin Walker), who considers this move towards disarmament as an act of treason. When Colonel Casey (Kirk Douglas) discovers a cryptic message on Scott’s desk relating to a top secret military base in Texas whose existence is unknown even to the Presidents, he becomes convinced that Scott will use the forthcoming Full Alert exercise to overthrow the US government. Having won the President’s trust, Casey gathers a small circle of loyal friends around him to go and seek evidence against Scott before the Alert deadline. All their efforts seem thwarted by accidental death or false imprisonment, until Casey obtains from Scott’s former lover Eleanor (Ava Gardner) incriminating letters that could be used to force his resignation. At a time of supreme US confidence in the solidity of their institutions, Frankenheimer delivered with ‘The Manchurian Candidate’ and ‘Seven Days in May’, two solid conspiracy theory films that were ahead of their time. Not before the 70s and a few fatal blows dealt to American optimism (Kennedy’s assassination, the Bay of Pigs), would the genre be revisited and flourish. ‘Seven Days in May’ is also a rare film: a taunt political thriller, rated G, with barely a gun shot or a swear word and whose razor-sharp dialogues and memorable quotes are delivered by old sparring partners Douglas and Lancaster. Based on the novel by Fletcher Knebel and Charles W. Bailey II

results.title: Seven brides for seven brothers (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Jack Cummings and Stanley Donen
results.brief_description: Seven brides for seven brothers is a funny, romantic, physically lively movie musical. It represents a wonderful mix of story, characters, song, ideas and dancing. In Oregon, when Adam Pontipee brings a bride back to the farm after a visit to town, Milly finds that she has to be not only a wife, but also mother to her brothers-in-law. The six brothers listen to Adam’s story of the sobbin’ women and decide to steal brides for themselves. Starring Howard Keel and Jane Powell.

results.title: Seven beauties = Pasqualino settebellezze
results.brief_description: Giancarlo Giannini is Pasqualino, a small-time crook in Naples, who when he is not busy making love and making money, is protecting the honour of his seven obese sisters, the beauties of the title. This amazing movie follows Pasqualino’s Candide-like adventures through an Italy ravaged by fascism and war: he kills one sister’s pimp, goes from prison to insane asylum, becomes a soldier and eventually an intern in a Nazi concentration camp. Regardless of the enormity of the horror and savagery he encounters, his main priority remains the assertion of his sexual and masculine prowess. Wertmuller has consistently explored the inter-relations between fascism and machismo. “Seven Beauties” remains her most wickedly subversive and audacious film, mixing black humour, lyrical film-making and scenes of almost unbearable brutality to expose the perversity of class relations. Though this film may offend many viewers, precisely because it does not as much condemn as ridicule fascism, for others this will be a liberating film to watch. This is truly anarchic film-making. Also stars Fernando Rey. NB: This film is dubbed in English.

results.title: Serpico
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Martin Bregman and Sidney Lumet
results.brief_description: Al Pacino gives one of the screen’s great performances as Frank Serpico, a young New York cop, who is appalled by the bribery and corruption in Police Departments. Serpico refuses the many bribes which are offered him and in doing so finds himself disowned and outlawed by his colleagues to such a degree that their hostility almost costs him his life. His lone fight against corruption ultimately leads to a full-scale enquiry into police crime. Based on the book by Waldo Salt.

results.title: Serial Mom
results.creator_credit: Polar Entertainment, John Fiedler, Mark Tarlov and John Waters
results.brief_description: A combination of Mrs Brady and Murphy Brown, Beverly Sutphin (Kathleen Turner) is fiercely protective of her family, she will do anything to ensure their happiness, anything! She’s an active member of the PTA, a devoted wife to her dentist husband and a great housekeeper. She is “Super Mom”. Still waters, however, run deep and beneath the surface lies a multitude of secrets. Mom isn’t all she’s cracked up to be. Her son’s teacher suddenly disappears after recommending therapy for the boy to deal with his obsession for gore. Her daughter’s boyfriend winds up dead after he fails to call her when he said he would. The one of Dad’s patients forgets to floss and pays the ultimate price.

results.title: Sergeant York
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Jesse L Lasky, Hal B Wallis and Howard Hawks
results.brief_description: He was a pacifist, turned patriot; a backwoods farmboy and ace Turkey Shoot champ who decided there are some things worth fighting for. Sergeant Alvin C. York became the renowned hero of World War I, capturing 132 German soldiers during the savage fighting in the Argonne. York insisted that if a film was to be made of his life, he wanted Gary Cooper only to play his character. This performance earned Cooper an Oscar. Under the direction of Howard Hawks, and with a cast that included Walter Brennan and Joan Leslie, this film will remain an all time classic.

results.title: Serenade
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Henry Blanke and Anthony Mann
results.brief_description: A musical feast for lovers of opera and fans of tenor Mario Lanza. Lanza plays Damon Vincenti, an unknown tenor who is plucked from obscurity when he is discovered by society patroness Kendall Hale (Joan Fontaine). With smooth impresario Charles Winthrop (Vincent Price) and voice teacher Maestro Marcatello (Joseph Calleia) behind him Vincenti is on the road to a great career as a tenor, but he becomes mesmerised by Kendall Hale. Hale has already had a string of heartbroken men who have been her pet projects in the past, and Damon is set to be her next victim. On the night of his debut at the New York Opera she drops him for her next protege. Damon is devastated and flees in the middle of his debut. He escapes to Mexico and is unable to sing. He is ‘rescued’ by Juana Montes (Sara Montiel) a fiery but patient Mexican girl whose father was a bull fighter. Eventually Damon marries Juana and they head back to America to restart his career. A showdown between the two women is set up as they fight over Vincenti. Fans of Lanza’s voice will appreciate the numerous songs he sings in this film, including “Serenade”,”Ave Maria” and “Nessun Dorma”.

results.title: Separate tables
results.creator_credit: Clifton Productions, Harold Hecht and Delbert Mann
results.brief_description: This sensitive character study, set in an English seaside hotel, looks at human frailties as seen through the eyes of a small group of residents, many tortured by emotional turmoil and unhappy pasts. Stars Rita Hayworth, Deborah Kerr and Burt Lancaster including Academy Award performances by David Niven and Wendy Hiller for Best Actor and Best Supporting Actress. Based on the play by Terence Rattigan.

results.title: Sense and sensibility (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Mirage Enterprises, Columbia Pictures, Lindsay Doran and Ang Lee
results.brief_description: Ang Lee directs this well scripted, acted and beautifully photographed version of Jane Austen’s first novel. Emma Thompson, (who wrote the screenplay), and Kate Winslet are Elinor and Marianne. Elinor follows her head and Marianne is guided by her heart. Both sisters eventually find love but only after the usual complications. A star-studded cast includes Hugh Grant and Alan Rickman
